alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 5:08PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN BOURBON COUNTY... At 507 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 1 mile northwest of Fort Scott, moving east at 10 mph. Other storms were located near Harding and Mapleton, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Fort Scott... Marmaton... Fulton... Redfield... Mapleton... Hammond... Devon... Harding... HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
